intro: Marsdenia cambodiensis, commonly known as the Cambodian Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Marsdenia cambodiensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in lowland forests and along riverbanks.
